item.title: Oxford Road - Brent side, 20th November
item.description:
Brent side of the oxford road is full of leaves again. This season of the year there needs to be more frequent cleaning as it is extremely slippery. As always the other side of the road is squeaky clean!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Oxford Road, London

item.title: Road floods after rainfall, 20th November
item.description:
Following periods of rain, water accumulates between the road and the pavement. There is a significant amount (puddle probably 3m x 1m) and it sits exactly at the pedestrian crossing. There is no drain (which would help) so itâ€™s not blocked, so it must be due to the lay of the land.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Headcorn Road, Sundridge, Bromley, London Borough of Lewisham

item.title: Constant rubbish dumping on this stretch of road, 20th November
item.description:

item.title: Light from lamp post is too bright in the bedrooms of my private property, 19th November
item.description:

item.title: Parking, 19th November
item.description:
Cars are parking inside Christopher close blocking emergency vehicles as well as rubbish trucks. These drivers live in nearby new build developments that have no parking or park here and drive to the station. Yellow lines need to be painted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-6, Christopher Close, Rotherhithe, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet
